EZD6.Compendium.Core.Boons.Lore.Name: Lore
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Boons.Melee.Name: Melee weapons
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Boons.Ranged.Name: Ranged weapons
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Boons.Strength.Name: Strength
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Gear.Potions.Healin: Heals 2 strikes and can drink as a free action
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Inclinations.Alchem:
You know potion-making and have a boon in the identification of substances. Start with two free healing potions or roll random ones on the potion table. (Taking a potion is a free action.) 

_Healing potion heals 2 strikes._
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Inclinations.Attune: You can blind fight and escape areas of obscured vision that can befuddle the direction of others.
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Inclinations.BornBl: You start each session with 6 karma instead of 3.
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Inclinations.Bright: Once per session you can call on the RR who will give your hero a helpful clue or bit of useful information about the current situation, and award you one Power Die (use or pass out) to complete any task related to the information.
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Inclinations.Catlik: Can only ever be knocked prone if hit by a crit and have a 4+ miraculous save when falling.
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Inclinations.CheckM: You can intercept foes before they reach a target near to you and they can not move away the next round without being punished. If they try to retreat or move away you get a free attack and if you hit them they can not move away (free action).
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Inclinations.Chirur: You can heal allies 1 Strike given time and supplies between scenes. Start with a healing kit that has 6 uses.
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Inclinations.Craftp: If building a hero with a vocation, see aspects.
Your demeanor encourages diplomatic or amenable solutions. Boon to all social checks.
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Inclinations.Danger: You cannot be surprised and have a boon in avoiding traps.
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Inclinations.Darede: Once per scene, complete any (non-combat) action task, such as leaping from an out-of-control wagon or swinging from one ship to another, unless you roll 1 (or snake eyes if you have a Boon in acrobatics).
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Inclinations.Devout:
You are a pious follower and can call on your deity for **miracles** but the gods are notoriously fickle.

_(see the miracles rules)_
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Inclinations.Faihfu: Demons and Undead can only hit you on a 5+.
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Inclinations.Famili:
You have a small imp-like servant that will obey simple commands. You grow a teat somewhere on your body that the creature suckles a small quantity of blood every night. Those of holy disposition will never bond one of these creatures.

_(stats for the familiar can be found in the monster section)_
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Inclinations.Fighte:
You have a boon in melee weapons. 

_(Note-If already trained you can’t take this inclination. You can’t be double trained)._
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Inclinations.Flanki: If another hero attacks your target in melee, they gain a Boon (excludes ranged).
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Inclinations.Hatred: Your loathing and disgust with undead and demons empowers your melee attacks. If you roll a 6 while attacking an undead or demon, you automatically inflict a second strike and can continue to roll the crit.
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Inclinations.HedgeW: You have no sorcery yourself but can use scrolls to cast spells. Start with 2 random spell scrolls.
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Inclinations.Heroic: You can buy back your Hero Die for 3 Karma instead of 5.
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Inclinations.HolyRe: Any time a demon or undead inflicts a strike on you,roll 1D6 and on a 4+ it also takes a strike itself.
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Inclinations.Inspir: You can share your karma points with anyone you can see.
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Inclinations.IronWi: You have a boon under mental attack or feared.
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Inclinations.Lockpi:
No lock can defeat you. As long as you have lockpicking tools, you can always succeed in picking a normal mechanical lock. Roll 1D6 to see how long it takes (lower roll takes longer). 

You start with a set of 3 lockpicks. A roll of 1 breaks your lockpicks.
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Inclinations.Magick: Work out a minor non-damaging power with the RR (such as spider climbing, telescopic eyes, grabbing tongue, face morph, or bloodhound nose) that can be activated with your ‘free action’ and requires no roll. You also gain a physical feature that stands out, such as bulging eyes, a bestial nose, or extra long fingers. (Can only be taken once.)
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Inclinations.Marksm:
You have a boon in ranged weapons. 

_(Note: If already trained you can not take this inclination. You can not be double trained)._
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Inclinations.Master: With RR permission, you start with a ship; you have intimate expertise of your vessel, and add a Boon when aiding your crew with a task.
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Inclinations.Nimbus: As a free action, you can summon a floating orb of light that follows you for the day. You can dispel it at any time but then must wait for the next day to summon it.
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Inclinations.Otherw:
You have been bound to an extra-dimensional entity (add details as a 3rd aspect), and your Patron grants you 1 PD (see Power Die) a day for as long as you work to further its ends.

_The RR will work out any consequences for defiance, and you may not take the ‘Devout’ Inclination._
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Inclinations.Quicks: Move away from melee without having to roll a contest (only applies if using the optional rule, see **Moving Away from Melee**) and gain a Boon to Miraculous Saves for escaping area effects.
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Inclinations.Resist:
Gain a Boon in 2 different resistances: poison, disease, fire, cold (ice), life drain, or transmutation (such as ‘turn to stone’). 

_Can be taken multiple times as long as no option is taken twice._
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Inclinations.Reveng: If an ally within sight takes their last strike, that ally gets 1 free ‘final action’ with a Boon, and you gain a Hero Die.
A Boon to control mounts, and can mount or dismount with your free action.
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Inclinations.Silent: Your melee kills are noiseless and do not draw attention if you attack by surprise and are not observed.
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Inclinations.Slippe:
You can roll to escape any “bad situation” on a 4+ (grabbed, rock falls on you, etc…).
Although you cannot escape a combat hit, you can roll to escape a grapple. This roll takes no action. It just happens.
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Inclinations.Sneaky: You have a boon in hiding and moving around unseen.
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Inclinations.Sniper: If shooting from a concealed position, gain a Boon to hit and crit on 5+ for your first attack.
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Inclinations.Sticky: You can steal small objects from targets and remain unnoticed given the opportunity, unless you roll a 1.
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Inclinations.SweepO: You can melee attack all enemies next to you as your action (roll for each target).
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Inclinations.Thauma: You know minor magick tricks. These are non-harmful manifestations like moving small objects slowly or solitary minor illusions like sight/sound/smell. They must be concentrated on and are quick to fade away.
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Inclinations.ToughB: When you would take your last strike roll a 4+ on a single die. If you succeed, power through and do not take the strike.
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Inclinations.Trapfi: You have a boon spotting and disabling traps.
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Inclinations.Treasu: You have a nose for finding hidden treasure and will always sense it if nearby.
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Inclinations.TwistO: Once a day, turn your roll of 1 into a 6.
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Inclinations.Victor: You gain two karma for every failed roll.
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Path.Beastmaster.Be: Given circumstances, you can convince beasts to aid you for a limited time.

You can start the game with a beast companion.
The beast is your friend, not your slave. It stays with you as long as well treated and protected. The beast can be up to medium size and has 2 Strikes or 1 Strike for a small animal. Consult with the RR for any boons your beast might have.
You can speak to any animal.
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Path.Beastmaster.De: You have realized your gift with animals is rare and wonderful.
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Path.Brute.Desc: A terrifying force of iron muscle and primal rage.
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Path.Brute.Enrage.D: You can sacrifice one of your own strikes to infl ict an extra strike on a combat hit.
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Path.Brute.Name: Hero Path: Brute
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Path.Conjurer.Desc: A master of the powerful forces of magick.
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Path.Conjurer.Maste: Gain mastery in one circle of sorcery.
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Path.Conjurer.Mysti: As an action you can shield yourself with magic until it absorbs a hit or you fall unconscious.
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Path.Conjurer.Name: Hero Path: Conjurer
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Path.Conjurer.Seeke: Can cast magick from scrolls. Start the game with two random scrolls.
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Path.Conjurer.WandO:
You can shoot mystic bolts from a wand or staff.
This is a ranged attack hitting one target and rolling 1D6; cannot crit and will only ever do one strike on a hit.
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Path.Delver.Desc: You call dark holes and dank dungeons home.
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Path.Delver.Gear.De: Always ready for a delve, you have a climbing kit with small but strong pitons looped with metal rings as a rope guide (X24), 50’ of thin strong rope, 5 torches, a small hammer, and white chalk sticks.
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Path.Delver.Jack.De: You may pick a bonus inclination (If human pick 4, if another species pick 3).
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Path.Delver.Name: Hero Path: Delver
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Path.Friar.Desc: A holy roller, a pious servant or a crackpot… You decide.
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Path.Friar.Empathic: Heal anyone within near range by absorbing one strike (they heal one, you gain one) as a free action.
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Path.Friar.HolyLigh:
As an action you call down a holy light. The light can either **heal nearby allies or damage enemies**. To heal, roll dice equal to the number of near allies. For each **4+ rolled** you heal one strike on each ally of your choice. You may attack enemies near you for 1 strike each or 2 to undead and demons. Holy Light can be used once a day unless you spend **5 karma to recover** the ability. (Note: Unlike normal miracles or magick you can use karma to boost rolls to 4.)

_Roll pear each ally._
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Path.Friar.Name: Hero Path: Friar
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Path.Rascal.Desc: Some may call you a criminal, but that depends on your perspective.
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Path.Rascal.Gank.De:
If you surprise a foe or an enemy is engaged with another combatant, you roll 2D6 attack dice and do a wound for each die that hits (each hit can still crit)

_Roll twice_
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Path.Rascal.Name: Hero Path: Rascal
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Path.Rascal.QuickOn: Save against wounds on a 6 but roll 2 dice and use the higher/roll the same for miraculous saves
As a free action, once per turn, you can avoid a single melee strike. Describe what you do to avoid the hit. Any attack roll except a 6 can be avoided.
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Path.Skald.Desc: Stories are your trade and legends your inspiration.
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Path.Skald.Name: Hero Path: Skald
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Path.Skald.Scrollma:
You can cast magick from scrolls. You start the
game with two random scrolls.
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Path.Skald.Traveler: On your travels you have had ample opportunity to hone a skill. Pick a skill (examples, melee, acrobatics, streetsmart, observation etc…) and gain a boon in that ability.
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Path.Warden.Desc: Few can escape your over-land tracking skills and deadeye shots.
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Path.Warden.Forager: You can sustain yourself in the outdoors. You can also sustain others depending on the size of the group and circumstances.
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Path.Warden.Name: Hero Path: Warden
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Path.Warden.Trailfi: You can follow traces left by passing creatures.
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Path.Warrior.Brutal: You are a master of **two-handed** weapons. You **crit on a 5-6** instead of just a 6. (No shield)
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Path.Warrior.Desc: Always on the front line dealing pain to those who oppose you.
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Path.Warrior.DualWe: You are deadly when using **two weapons**. You have an **extra boon** when fighting with dual weapons so you **roll 3D6 to attack** and take the highest die. (No shield)
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Path.Warrior.Name: Hero Path: Warrior
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Path.Warrior.Shield: As a free action (once per scene) you can **deflect** all attack damage from yourself or a close ally for this round but your **shield breaks** and is destroyed. This maneuver can even be activated after the damage has been inflicted. Your armor Save then goes **from 3+ to 4+** (You can avoid the break by spending 5 karma)
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Path.Warrior.Supers:
You have a boon to resist any magick you do not
want to aff ect you.
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Species.Dwarf.Desc:
Tunnel sight (see twice as far in dim light)
Boon to resist poison
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Species.Dwarf.Name: Species: Dwarf
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Species.Dwarf.Tunne: See twice as far in dim light.
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Species.Elf.Desc:
Twilight sight (see twice as far in dim light)
Boon to resist mind-altering magicks
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Species.Elf.Name: Species: Elf
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Species.Elf.Twiligh: See twice as far in dim light.
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Species.Goblin.Desc:
Nooks and crannies.As a move a goblin can jump into cover and avoid being attacked for a turn if they don’t attack. Cover or broken ground must be near the goblin.
Night sight (see twice as far in dim light)
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Species.Goblin.Name: Species: Goblin
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Species.Goblin.Nigh: See twice as far in dim light.
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Species.Goblin.Nook: As a move a goblin can jump into cover and avoid being attacked for a turn if they don’t attack. Cover or broken ground must be near the goblin.
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Species.Halfing.Des:
Another breakfast. Start with a healing potion (heals 2 strikes and can drink as a free action)
Larger foes have difficulty hitting you. (+1 to your Target #)
EZD6.Compendium.Core.Species.Human.Name: Species: Human
EZD6.Compendium.Resources.HeroDie.Desc: Earn at session start, expend to re-roll 1 die. Spend 5 Karma to replenish your HERO DIE.
EZD6.Compendium.Resources.HeroDie.Name: Hero Die
EZD6.Compendium.Resources.Karma.Desc: Earn 1 Karma on any failed roll. Limit one per turn for failed rolls. Add Karma to any roll, besides a 1. Cannot use on Magick or Miracles. Spend 5 Karma to replenish your HERO DIE.
EZD6.Compendium.Resources.Karma.Name: Karma
EZD6.Compendium.Resources.Strikes.Desc:
**One hit = one strike of damage.**
Magick and special abilities can help heroes heal strikes, however you can also recover one strike naturally by eating a meal and resting for the night.
EZD6.Compendium.Resources.Strikes.Name: Strikes
EZD6.Compendium.Resources.Wealth.Desc:
* **PAUPER** - Can barely scrounge enough cash for food and may have to go without meals.
* **CASH POOR** - Can aff ord food and simple clothing but little else.
* **MODERATE** - Can buy most gear, armor, weapons, and rented accommodations.
* **WEALTHY** - Can easily aff ord transport like horses and wagons as well as permanent accommodations and retain a small staff.
* **LORDLY WEALTH** - Can aff ord to own ships or other transport and a cohort of retainers.
* **KINGLY WEALTH** - Money is no issue unless creating a massive project.
EZD6.Compendium.Resources.Wealth.Name: Wealth
EZD6.Compendium.Saves.Armor.Desc:
When hit, roll Armor to ignore 1 Strike.
If you are hit for multiple strikes (like a сrit) you get to make the roll for each strike point.
EZD6.Compendium.Saves.Armor.Name: Armor
EZD6.Compendium.Saves.Magic.Desc: The caster must equal or beat the resistance number of the highest resistance die roll.
EZD6.Compendium.Saves.Magic.Name: Magic Resistance
EZD6.Compendium.Saves.Miraculous.Desc: Some events can happen that armor will not protect you from. In those cases make a miraculous save roll instead of an armor save.
EZD6.Compendium.Saves.Miraculous.Name: Miraculous
